intro: Ficus adelpha, commonly known as the silver fig, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that have a silvery underside, giving it a striking appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible figs that are typically yellow or reddish in color. It thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Ficus adelpha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to indoor conditions.
